xxl.core.indexStructures.vLengthBPlusTree

Class VariableLengthBPlusTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.indexStructures.Tree
      • xxl.core.indexStructures.vLengthBPlusTree.VariableLengthBPlusTree

  • public class VariableLengthBPlusTree
extends Tree
    This class implements a B+Tree. B+Tree handle keys and data as variable length with a max size defined by the MeasuredConverter
    See Also:
    MeasuredConverter#getMaxObjectSize()}. With two functions @see {@link VariableLengthBPlusTree#getActualEntrySize} and @see {@link VariableLengthBPlusTree#getActualKeySize} the serialized size of the object or key computed. The reorganization of the nodes are based not on the number of the elements but on the overall byte size of the node. The initialization of the B+Tree awaits a SplitStrategy and underflow handler as a parameter:, SplitStrategy},, UnderflowHandler}, StandardUnderflowHandler}, ShortestKeyStrategy}, SimplePrefixBPlusTreeSplit} For a detailed discussion see Douglas Comer: "The Ubiquitous B-Tree", ACM Comput. Surv. 11(2), 121-137, 1979.

    • Field Detail

      • BLOCK_SIZE

        public final int BLOCK_SIZE
        This declares the block size of the underlying external storage. This field is initialized finally in the constructor by the value given from the user as a parameter. It is used to compute the maximal capacity of the tree's nodes.ert

        protected MeasuredConverter dataConverter

    • Constructor Detail

      • VariableLengthBPlusTree

        public VariableLengthBPlusTree(int blockSize,
                               double minAllowedLoad)
        Creates a new empty B+Tree. Before running B+Tree it should be initialized. Key Duplicates are not allowed.
        Parameters:
        blockSize -
        minAllowedLoad - is a minimal fraction of page / node capacity in bytes that each node after the reorganization should fulfill. e.g. 0.4 This parameter is used for computing the suitable split index.
        See Also:
        initialize(IndexEntry, Descriptor, Function, Container, MeasuredConverter, MeasuredConverter, Function, Function, Function, Function, SplitStrategy, UnderflowHandler)

      • VariableLengthBPlusTree

        public VariableLengthBPlusTree(int blockSize,
                               double minAllowedLoad,
                               boolean duplicates)
        Creates a new empty B+Tree. Before running B+Tree it should be initialized. Managing of duplicate keys can be switched with parameter duplicates.
        Parameters:
        blockSize -
        minAllowedLoad -
        duplicates -
        See Also:
        initialize(IndexEntry, Descriptor, Function, Container, MeasuredConverter, MeasuredConverter, Function, Function, Function, Function, SplitStrategy, UnderflowHandler)

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        protected VariableLengthBPlusTree initialize(Function getKey,
                                             MeasuredConverter keyConverter,
                                             MeasuredConverter dataConverter,
                                             Function createSeparator,
                                             Function createKeyRange,
                                             Function getSplitMinRatio,
                                             Function getSplitMaxRatio)
        Initializes the BPlusTree.
        Parameters:
        getKey - the Function to get the key of a data object
        keyConverter - the Converter for the keys used by the tree
        dataConverter - the Converter for data objects stored in the tree
        createSeparator - a factory Function to create Separators
        createKeyRange - a factory Function to create KeyRanges
        getSplitMinRatio - a Function to determine the minimal relative number of entries which the node may contain after a split
        getSplitMaxRatio - a Function to determine the maximal relative number of entries which the node may contain after a split
        Returns:
        the initialized BPlusTree itself

      • initialize

        public VariableLengthBPlusTree initialize(VariableLengthBPlusTree.IndexEntry rootEntry,
                                          Descriptor rootDescriptor,
                                          Function getKey,
                                          Container container,
                                          MeasuredConverter keyConverter,
                                          MeasuredConverter dataConverter,
                                          Function createSeparator,
                                          Function createKeyRange,
                                          Function<Object,Integer> getActualKeySize,
                                          Function<Object,Integer> getActualEntrySize,
                                          SplitStrategy splitStrategy,
                                          UnderflowHandler underflowHandler)
        This method initializes the B+Tree. It also initializes SplitStrategy and UnderflowHanlder Objects.
        Parameters:
        rootEntry - rootEntry of the tree
        rootDescriptor - rootDescriptor of the tree; @see BPlusTree.KeyRange
        getKey - function which extract a key from the data which is tored in the leaf nodes
        container - container of the tree
        keyConverter - converter of the tree which is @see MeasuredConverter and provides information about maximal size in bytes
        dataConverter - converter of the tree which is @see MeasuredConverter and provides information about maximal size in bytes
        createSeparator - factory function for creating the separtor @see Separator
        createKeyRange - factory function for creating key ranges @see BPlusTree.KeyRange
        getActualKeySize - function which gives the serialized size of the current key in bytes
        getActualEntrySize - function which gives the serialized size of the current key in bytes
        splitStrategy - strategy class for to run split. @see VariableLengthBPlusTree.Node.split(Stack)
        underflowHandler - strategy for handling underflow on the nodes @see VariableLengthBPlusTree.Node.redressUnderflow(Stack)
        Returns:

      • separator

        public Separator separator(Object entry)
        It is used to determine the Separator of a given entry (e.g. IndexEntry, data entry, etc.). It is equivalent to: 
         <code>
 return (Separator) descriptor(entry);
 </code>
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry whose Separator is required
        Returns:
        the Separator of the given entry

      • container

        public Container container()
        Gives the Container used by the BPlusTree to store the nodes. It is equivalent to: 
         return (Container) this.getContainer.invoke(this);
        NOTE: This only makes sense if the whole Tree is stored in a single Container. This method is used by the default NodeConverter. Therefore the user has to overwrite the NodeConverter if the tree works in multidisk mode.
        Returns:
        the Container of the BPlusTree

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks whether the BPlusTree is empty. The BPlusTree is empty if the rootEntry is null or the root node is empty.
        Returns:
        true if the BPlusTree is empty and false otherwise

      • getLastDescriptor

        public Descriptor getLastDescriptor()
        Gives last used Descriptor for a query.
        Returns:
        last used Descriptor for a query.

      • remove

        public Object remove(Object data)
        This method is used to remove a data object from the tree. It uses the method BPlusTree.separator(Object)to get the Separator of the given object. Thereafter it searches in the tree for an Object with the same Separator. The method {Separator#equals{Object)} is used to check whether two Separators are the same. NOTE: In duplicate mode the objects are compared with o1.equals(o2)
        Overrides:
        remove in class Tree
        Parameters:
        data - the object which has to be removed
        Returns:
        the removed object if the search was successful, and null otherwise
        See Also:
        Tree.remove(Object,Predicate)

      • remove

        public Object remove(Descriptor descriptor,
                     int targetLevel,
                     Predicate test)
        Removes the object which is specified by the given descriptor. First query is called: 
         <code>
                Iterator objects = query(descriptor, targetLevel);
        Then the first object which meets the test(Predicate) is removed from the tree and returned.
        Overrides:
        remove in class Tree
        Parameters:
        descriptor - specifies the query
        targetLevel - the level on which the query has to stop
        test - a predicate the object to remove has to fulfill
        Returns:
        the removed object or null if there was no such object

      • insert

        protected void insert(Object data,
                      Descriptor descriptor,
                      int targetLevel)
        Inserts an object into a given level of the tree. If level > 0 data has to be an IndexEntry (this only makes sense for trees whose index nodes support Node.grow()).
        Overrides:
        insert in class Tree
        Parameters:
        data - the data to insert
        descriptor - is used to find the node into which data must be inserted
        targetLevel - is the tree-level into which data has to be inserted (targetLevel==0 means insert into the suitable leaf node)

      • aloneKeyQuery

        public Cursor aloneKeyQuery(Comparable key)
        Searches for data objects with the given key stored in the BPlusTree. It calls 
         KeyRange range = createKeyRange(key, key);
 return query(range, 0);
        . Returns the set of results as a cursor. If the tree is not in duplicate mode UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:
        cursor
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - when the tree is not in duplicate mode

      • exactMatchQuery

        public Object exactMatchQuery(Comparable key)
        Searches the single data object with the given key stored in the BPlusTree.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the data object which has to be searched
        Returns:
        the single data object with the given key or null if no such object could be found
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - when the tree is in duplicate mode

      • exactMatchQuery

        protected Object exactMatchQuery(Comparable key,
                                 Predicate test)
        Searches for the single entry with the given key stored in the BPlusTree which fulfills the given Predicate. The method query(Descriptor queryDescriptor, int targetLevel) takes over the search process.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the data object which has to be searched
        test - a Predicate which the found entry has to fulfill
        Returns:
        the single data object with the given key or null if no such object could be found

      • rangeQuery

        public Cursor rangeQuery(Comparable minKey,
                         Comparable maxKey)
        Searches all data objects stored in the tree whose key lie in the given key range [minKey, maxKey]. The method query(Descriptor queryDescriptor, int targetLevel) takes over the search process.
        Parameters:
        minKey - the minimal boundary of the query's key range
        maxKey - the maximal boundary of the query's key range
        Returns:
        a Cursor pointing all qualified entries

      • query

        public Cursor query(Descriptor queryDescriptor,
                    int targetLevel)
        This method calls #query(IndexEntry subRootEntry, KeyRange queryInterval,int targetLevel) which uses an implementation of an efficient querying algorithm. The result is a lazy Cursor pointing to all entries whose keys are contained in queryDescriptor. Initially query creates the correct parameters for the call.
        Overrides:
        query in class Tree
        Parameters:
        queryDescriptor - describes the query in terms of a Descriptor. In this case it has to an instance of Separator oder KeyRange
        targetLevel - the tree-level to provide the answer-objects
        Returns:
        a lazy Cursor pointing to all response objects

      • query

        protected Cursor query(VariableLengthBPlusTree.IndexEntry subRootEntry,
                       BPlusTree.KeyRange queryInterval,
                       int targetLevel)
        This method uses an implementation of an efficient querying algorithm. The result is a lazy Cursor pointing to all entries whose keys are contained in queryDescriptor. Method creates object of type BPlusTree.QueryCursor
        Parameters:
        subRootEntry - the root of the subtree in which the query is to execute
        queryInterval - describes the query in terms of a Descriptor. In this case it has to be an instance of KeyRange
        targetLevel - the tree-level to provide the answer-objects
        Returns:
        a lazy Cursor pointing to all response objects

      • treatUnderflow

        protected void treatUnderflow(Stack path)
        This method is called after an entry was removed in order to repair the index structure.
        Parameters:
        path - the path from the root to the Node from which the entry was removed

      • treatOverflow

        protected void treatOverflow(Stack path)
        This method is called after a new entry was inserted in order to repair the index structure.
        Parameters:
        path - the path from the root to the Node into which the new entry was inserted
